quotes: In April and May 1976, Salim led an ad hoc group of six members from the UN Special Committee on Decolonization to Lusaka, Dar es Salaam, Addis Ababa, Maputo, Gaborone and London to hold consultations on the decolonisation efforts in Rhodesia and Namibia.

organizations.name: OAU
quotes: The ideological and diplomatic positions espoused by the FLS were to become driving forces behind Salim’s approach to decolonisation.

These consultations, which engaged heads of state and government officials, representatives from the OAU executive and its Liberation Committee, and members of the various liberation movements, were important steps towards improving collaboration between the UN Special Committee on Decolonization and the newly formed FLS coalition.

One of the recommendations from the 1976 consultations was that the Special Committee on Decolonization … should continue to maintain a close working relationship with the Governments of the four front-line States and other concerned Member States, the General Secretariat of [the] OAU and

organizations.name: UN
quotes: Although each of the various bodies – the OAU, the UN and the FLS coalition – operated in its own framework and context, Salim played a critical role in ensuring the coherence and interplay between them throughout his diplomatic career.

In April and May 1976, Salim led an ad hoc group of six members from the UN Special Committee on Decolonization to Lusaka, Dar es Salaam, Addis Ababa, Maputo, Gaborone and London to hold consultations on the decolonisation efforts in Rhodesia and Namibia.

organizations.name: FLS coalition
quotes: The Dar es Salaam Declaration strongly advised the FLS to directly negotiate with the Pretoria government over the situations in Namibia and Rhodesia without sacrificing the coalition members’ commitment to the armed struggle or their unwavering opposition to all forms of apartheid.

These consultations, which engaged heads of state and government officials, representatives from the OAU executive and its Liberation Committee, and members of the various liberation movements, were important steps towards improving collaboration between the UN Special Committee on Decolonization and the newly formed FLS coalition.

Although each of the various bodies – the OAU, the UN and the FLS coalition – operated in its own framework and context, Salim played a critical role in ensuring the coherence and interplay between them throughout his diplomatic career.

The Dar es Salaam Declaration clarified that the issues of Namibia and Rhodesia, defined in the context of decolonisation and majority rule, should be separated from those of racial discrimination and legal apartheid in South Africa.

assembled_events.notes: The event is clearly a career position as it involves leading a group and holding consultations, which are active responsibilities.

issues.description: The event is missing specific organization details. While the UN Special Committee on Decolonization is mentioned, the additional organizations (OAU, FLS coalition) are not directly linked to the event in the supporting quote.
The role 'led an ad hoc group' is somewhat vague and could benefit from more specific details about the responsibilities or outcomes of leading the group.
